instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook it gets 20v but no image or backlight. The client said last thing that happened to it was the sign like the SSD is not readable but when i got it no image. No shorted lines and i get the power lines, CPU seems to be heating up normal not overheating... Any ideas?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Bad CPU, as always.
Don't waste time on it.
Fixing backlight/image will still let you in SSD problem...
